summary: This is an email from June 29, 2008, discussing preparations for a presentation and confirming that a prosecutor named Goldberger has accepted a proposed change to a plea agreement, indicating the plea is likely to proceed the next day unless Jeffrey Epstein changes his mind.

persons.name: Goldberger
persons.context: Mentioned as having accepted a proposed change to the plea agreement, indicating a key legal official in the Epstein case negotiations.

persons.name: Mr. Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the defendant who could change his mind about moving forward with a plea agreement the following day.

connections.description: Goldberger, as a prosecutor, has accepted a change to a plea agreement for Mr. Epstein, indicating an adversarial legal relationship.

events.title: Anticipated Plea Agreement Proceeding
events.description: The email states that the plea is set to move forward the next day (June 30, 2008) unless Mr. Epstein changes his mind, following Goldberger's acceptance of a proposed change to the agreement.

keyFacts: An email dated June 29, 2008, discusses an upcoming legal proceeding related to Jeffrey Epstein.
A prosecutor named Goldberger accepted a proposed change to a plea agreement.
The plea was anticipated to move forward on June 30, 2008, contingent on Epstein not changing his mind.
The context suggests ongoing plea negotiations in the Epstein case around mid-2008.
